title: Curved, Sharp Pointed Font?
content:
Anybody have any ideas based on the attached sketch for a font I could use to start out a logo project? Many thanks.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [scorpion\_sketch.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125063751/http:/typophile.com/files/scorpion_sketch_0.jpg) | 22.55 KB |
author: vaporKICKS

comments.content:
The first thing that came to mind was [Abaddon](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125063751/http:/www.dafont.com/abaddon.font?nb_ppp=50&text=SCORPION) or [Drakon](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125063751/http:/www.dafont.com/drakon.font?nb_ppp=50&text=SCORPION)

Another idea might be [Girlfriend](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125063751/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/girlfriend/?testdrive=custom%3D0%26dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D48%26w%3D720%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DSCORPION%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%252Csingle%26seed%3D22). Try searching 'halloween' at [www.myfonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125063751/http:/www.myfonts.com/ "www.myfonts.com").

Your sketch is pretty nice... have you considered scanning that and drawing the logo by hand in Illustrator?

Just ran across [Talon](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125063751/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/talon/?testdrive=custom%3D0%26dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D48%26w%3D720%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DSCORPION%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%252Csingle%26seed%3D24) from Font Bureau and remembered this post.

I keep finding more of these while trying to ID other requests.

[CCTreacherous-Curves](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125063751/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/comicraft/treacherous/?testdrive=custom%3D0%26dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D118%26w%3D720%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DSCORPION%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%26seed%3D29) from Comicraft.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125063751im_/http:/typophile.com/files/CCTreacherous-Curves_3494.png)

That Comicraft font seems to share some features with Abbadon, which was a Dave Nalle adaptation of a typeface by Alex Jay for a 1981 book called "The Dinosaurs" by William Stout. Jay's type design was inspired by lettering of Alfonse Mucha, the Art Nouveau illustrator and graphic artist.

- Mike Yanega
